title: Fenrir: Physics-Enhanced Regression for Initial Value Problems. (arXiv:2202.01287v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: We show how probabilistic numerics can be used to convert an initial value problem into a Gauss--Markov process parametrised by the dynamics of the initial value problem. Consequently, the often difficult problem of parameter estimation in ordinary differential equations is reduced to hyperparameter estimation in Gauss--Markov regression, which tends to be considerably easier. The method's relation and benefits in comparison to classical numerical integration and gradient matching approaches is elucidated. In particular, the method can, in contrast to gradient matching, handle partial observations, and has certain routes for escaping local optima not available to classical numerical integration. Experimental results demonstrate that the method is on par or moderately better than competing approaches.

translated_title: Fenrir: 物理增强初始化问题回归方法
translated_abstract: 我们展示了如何使用概率数值方法将初始值问题转化为由初始值问题动力学参数化的高斯-马尔科夫过程。因此，常见的微分方程参数估计问题被简化为高斯-马尔科夫回归的超参数估计，这往往更容易解决。我们阐述了该方法与经典数值积分和梯度匹配方法的关系和优势。特别地，与梯度匹配相比，该方法可以处理部分观测，并具有某些可逃脱经典数值积分局部最优的方法。实验结果表明，该方法与竞争方法相当或稍微更好。
tldr: Fenrir是一种通过概率数值方法将初始值问题转化为高斯-马尔科夫回归问题的方法，使微分方程参数估计任务更容易解决。该方法能够处理部分观测数据，并具有某些逃脱局部最优的方法。
en_tdlr: Fenrir is a physics-enhanced regression method for converting initial value problems to Gauss-Markov processes using probabilistic numerics, simplifying parameter estimation for ordinary differential equations. It outperforms classical methods in handling partial observations and escaping local optima. Results show comparable or better performance than competing approaches.
